title: Rotational kinetic energy - kinetic energy graph

content.question: The graph shows the rotational kinetic energy <math alttext="K sub rot" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>K</mi><mtext>rot</mtext></msub></math> and the translational kinetic energy <math alttext="K sub trans" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>K</mi><mtext>trans</mtext></msub></math> of a rigid object as functions of time. Times <math alttext="t sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>, <math alttext="t sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>, and <math alttext="t sub 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></math> are indicated on the graph. Which of the following correctly compares the total kinetic energy <math alttext="K" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>K</mi></math> of the object at times <math alttext="t sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>, <math alttext="t sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>, and <math alttext="t sub 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></math>?

choices.label: <math alttext="K sub 1 is greater than K sub 2, which is greater than K sub 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>K</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>K</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>K</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></math>

<math alttext="open parenthesis, K sub 1 equals K sub 2, close parenthesis, is greater than K sub 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mi>K</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>K</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>></mo><msub><mi>K</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></math>

<math alttext="K sub 1 is greater than, open parenthesis, K sub 2 equals K sub 3, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>K</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>></mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mi>K</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>K</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><mo>)</mo></mrow></math>

<math alttext="K sub 1 equals, K sub 2, which equals K sub 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>K</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>K</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>K</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="K sub 1 is greater than K sub 2, which is greater than K sub 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>K</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>K</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>K</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></math>

unit.text: 6: Energy and Momentum of Rotating Systems

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
